title: How to Make Moong Dal Cheela

steps.headline: Soak moong dal (green gram) and rice in lukewarm water for 4-5 hours.
Grind it and add water if necessary to grind it to paste.
Add grated ginger, chopped green chilli, salt and asafoetida (hing).
Heat a non-stick pan.Once it is uniformly heated, pour the batter using a serving spoon and spread it evenly in a round shape (just like dosa or pancake).
Cook on medium heat until the underside is done.
Carefully flip over and cook until the other side is done too.
Fold the cheela over to a half moon shape.
Rinse the coriander leaves well in water and roughly chop them.
Add chopped leaves, green chillies, salt and cumin seeds in blender jar and grind it.
steps.description: Do not add water else the chutney will be too watery.

steps.headline: Remove the chutney in a bowl and keep aside.
steps.description: Serve it with hot moong dal cheela.

text: Making Moong Dal Cheela Soak moong dal (green gram) and rice in lukewarm water for 4-5 hours.  Grind it and add water if necessary to grind it to paste.  Add grated ginger, chopped green chilli, salt and asafoetida (hing).  Heat a non-stick pan.Once it is uniformly heated, pour the batter using a serving spoon and spread it evenly in a round shape (just like dosa or pancake).  Cook on medium heat until the underside is done.  Carefully flip over and cook until the other side is done too.  Fold the cheela over to a half moon shape. Serve hot. Making Green Chutney Rinse the coriander leaves well in water and roughly chop them.  Add chopped leaves, green chillies, salt and cumin seeds in blender jar and grind it. Do not add water else the chutney will be too watery. Remove the chutney in a bowl and keep aside. Serve it with hot moong dal cheela.
